items.sentence: Tom wants to call his uncle, but he can\'t seem to get a hold of him.
Tom went upstairs with Mary and sat by her bed until she fell asleep.
Tom doesn\'t like swimming in this river. He says it\'s too polluted.
Tom appreciated all the letters Mary sent him while he was in prison.
Tom now has enough money to buy the guitar he\'s been wanting to buy.
Tom probably won\'t live long enough to see his daughter get married.
It looks like it might rain, so you should take an umbrella with you.
Tom wasn\'t surprised that Mary already knew about what had happened.
I wonder whether or not there\'s any cheese left in the refrigerator.
Tom tried to persuade his parents to let him go to Boston by himself.
You have to promise never to tell anyone what I\'m about to tell you.
Tom asked me to tell you he didn\'t plan on going to Boston with you.
Tom decided to step back and allow Mary to handle things for a while.
I\'m surprised that you didn\'t know that Tom couldn\'t speak French.
You should probably not tell Tom that you don\'t know how to do that.
Apparently, Tom was late because there was a traffic jam on Route 19.
I wasn\'t able to sing very well tonight because I had a sore throat.
We don\'t need any more volunteers, but we could use some more money.
Tom couldn\'t shake the feeling that he\'d met Mary somewhere before.
Some of the trees in our neighborhood were knocked down by the storm.
